result.execSummary:
The defendant Rolland S Zibell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--random drug screens at the discretion of the Agent
--submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 1:32pm [mo]
Defendant Rolland S Zibell in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Rhiel submits discharge summary and plan to the Court
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Ms. Michele McGratf makes a statement on behalf of Mr. Zibell
Statement made by Mr. Zibell

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--to serve 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
--The Defendant is ordered to report and serve the sentence with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--random drug screens at the discretion of the Agent
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions given
Days credit for time already served:  0  days

Case called at 8:29am [mo]
Defendant Rolland S Zibell in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Rhiel indicates that Mr. Zibell intends to accept a plea offer from the State. Further, Atty. Rhiel requests an adjourned sentencing to allow time to collect additional documentation pertinent to sentencing.
--no objection from ADA Shock

ADA Shock indicates that there is victim rights compliance for a plea hearing today.
recess: 8:33am--reconvene: 8:56am [to allow Atty. Rhiel and Mr. Zibell to finish paperwork]

On Motion of the State and Joint Agreement of the Parties,  the Court dismisses of the 'second or subsequent' enhancer of Count #1
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 without 'second or subsequent' enhancer; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

recess:9:07am

Case called at 9:07 am [sf]
Defendant Rolland S Zibell in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ advises that the State has victim rights compliance, and the Court so finds.

Detective Wayne Eilenfeldt --sworn & testifies
--direct exam by DA Happ
--cross exam by Attorney Rhiel

Attorney Rhiel presents argument against bind over.
Court basis and finds probable cause that Mr. Zibell committed a felony. Court binds him over for Arraignment.
Court and DA Happ discuss arraignment and information.
Court advises that it will proceed to Arrgainment with only Mr. Zibell listed on the Information, State is to Cross off co-actor's name and counts that relate to the co-actor.
State files Information
Court corrects by it's own hand information to make Count #2 to Count #1and corrects statute to 961.41(3g)(3) and corrects Count #3 to Count #2.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial is waived

DA Happ waives speedy trial.
DA Happ advises that the co-actor Mr. Fields may be in Green Lake County.

Court informs Attorney Rhiel that it does not have fingerprints on this file yet, Attorney Rhiel advises that he will have the defendant go to the jail.

recess: 9:39 am

[MK] case called at 1:21pm. 
Defendant Rolland S Zibell appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Zibell indicates that the 3417 Prairie Drive, Deerfield address is his current address, and that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense.

The Court requires a $150 Cash Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Thomas J. Field or Joshua Hanson 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, including needles, without a valid prescription
recess 1:pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/29/15 at 8:40am  (2) Status Conference on 5/26/15 at 9:00am. (JA- please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage)

case called at 4:43pm. [MK]
Defendant Rolland S Zibell not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall notes that Mr. Zibell has a pending felony case in Dane that shows an address of 897 Pleasant Street in Woodstock, IL, however mail to that address was returned with the indication that Mr. Zibell does not live there. 
The Court indicates that court staff telephoned the Clerk of Courts Office this morning to indicate that he cannot get transportation to appear today. 
The Court affirms its earlier finding of probable cause.
The Court authorizes issuance of a probable cause warrant.
recess 4:45pm.
Defendant called at 8:38 am to advise he has been unable to find a ride to court today. He was advised to call back later to see what the Court has ordered.
